snippet: Indiana pushed forward a constitutional amendment defining marriage as between a man and a woman, but language had been removed that some supporters of a ban had considered essential.
abstract: Indiana lawmakers push forward constitutional amendment defining marriage as between a man and a woman, but language is removed that some supporters of ban consider essential; move signals shift, almost certainly delaying statewide vote on matter for at least two years, leaving fate of ban uncertain.
lead_paragraph: Indiana pushed forward a constitutional amendment defining marriage as between a man and a woman, but language had been removed that some supporters of a ban had considered essential.

headline.main: In Diluting Measure to Ban Gay Marriage, Indiana Shows a Shift
headline.print_headline: In Diluting Measure to Ban Gay Marriage, Indiana Shows a Shift

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
